title: Main usage of harmonizR
text: easiest way get started harmonizR using vignette demo current version GitHub. download package, need account GitHub create secure key (format “ghp_xxx”). can send us Github name using following link can add authorized list users. Please note demo files mentioned downloadable Opal demo environment.
code: # To update the R package in your R environment you may first need to remove it,  # and use the exit command quit() to terminate the current R session. # Use the script below to install the R package. devtools::install_github(   repo = "https://github.com/maelstrom-research/harmonizR",   auth_token = "ghp_xxx",   force = TRUE)  library(harmonizR)  # additional packages needed in the demonstration library(tidyverse) library(opalr)  # please make sure that those libraries are installed on your R environment: #  # DT,         # tools,        # plotly,                     # bookdown,   # utils,        # readr,                           # dplyr,      # viridis,      # readxl,        # fs,         # xlsx,         # rlang,         # ggplot2,    # getPass,      # stringr,         # grDevices,  # knitr,        # tibble,         # janitor,    # car,          # tidyr,         # opalr,      # lubridate     # tidytext,       harmonizR_help()

title: Main usage of harmonizR
text: aim vignette walk harmonization process using library harmonizR illustrate main functions. harmonizR allows : Create R environment can place files organized structure Identify location content files environment Generate bookdown reports study-specific variables (input) Read interpret data processing elements (harmonization potential data processing rules) generate harmonized dataset(s) (output) Generate bookdown reports harmonized variables

what: Set up your harmonization R environment
title: Main usage of harmonizR
text: Create organized environment place files correctly control versions project. well-organized structure project facilitate harmonization work avoid confusion different versions project files (e.g., different versions datasets, data dictionaries, DataSchema, data processing elements).
code: # use case 1: create folder without versioning harmo_env_create(project = "DEMO")

title: Main usage of harmonizR
text: test use library harmonizR, can get access demo files downloadable Opal demo site. hesitate contact us using form previously mentioned .
code: o <- opal.login(username = 'administrator',                 password = 'password',                 url = 'https://opal-demo.maelstrom-research.org/')  opal_files_pull(o, from = "/home/administrator/DEMOv3/data_processing_elements", to = "DEMO") opal_files_pull(o, from = "/home/administrator/DEMOv3/dataschema",               to = "DEMO") opal_files_pull(o, from = "/home/administrator/DEMOv3/study_specific_datasets",  to = "DEMO")

what: Index the files in your harmonization R environment
title: Main usage of harmonizR
text: Create tibble listing files folder (recursively) useful metadata. can add filter query exclude folders indexing. tibble can also used quickly search location file. Finally, can read indexed files generate objects R environment.
code: # create index of files that are in a  folder index_DEMO <- file_index_create(folder = "DEMO")  # search index for files matching a specific file path query file_index_search(index = index_DEMO, file_path = "study_specific_datasets")  # read the files file_index_read(index = index_DEMO, file_path = "study_specific_datasets")

what: Generate visual report(s) of the study-specific variables
title: Main usage of harmonizR
text: can generate quality assessment (QA) reports study datasets. facilitate assessment study-specific datasets, can generate html bookdown report showing summary statistics study-specific variable. summary statistics figures generated according valueTypes. variable valueTypes automatically detected dataset data dictionary. can specify data dictionary, grouping variable get summary statistics group, output folder (specified, current folder default). See ggplot2, plotly DT documentation graphics tables generated report.
code: # use case 1: report of demo dataset TOKYO study_visual_report(   dataset = study_TOKYO,   data_dict = dd_TOKYO_format_maelstrom_tagged,   to = "DEMO/reports/TOKYO")  # use case 2: report of demo dataset TOKYO, grouped by gndr study_visual_report(   dataset = study_TOKYO,   data_dict = dd_TOKYO_format_maelstrom_tagged,   to = "DEMO/reports/TOKYO_gndr",group_by = "gndr",out = "ggplot2")  # re-index your files to include new files created index_DEMO <- file_index_create(folder = "DEMO")  # read the bookdown file_index_read(index_DEMO,file_path = "DEMO/reports/TOKYO_gndr/docs/index.html")

what: Read and run the data processing rules and generate the harmonized dataset
title: Main usage of harmonizR
text: Read run data processing elements file line line whole harmonize study-specific dataset. Error messages generated automatically help identify sources errors data processing elements. Separate scripts pre-processing datasets (harmonization) post-processing (harmonization) can integrated process.
code: # Read the files file_index_read(index_DEMO, file_path = "study_specific_datasets") file_index_read(index_DEMO, file_path = "dataschema") file_index_read(index_DEMO, file_path = "data_processing_elements")  # Example 1: run the process of harmonization with data processing elements containing errors harmo_process(   dataschema = DEMO_dataschema,   data_proc_elem = `DEMO_data_processing_elements - with error`,   output_harmo_folder = "DEMO/harmonized_datasets",   name_report = "harmo_report")  # Example 2: use the function harmo_summary() to access the errors.  # In your environment, you will find a report attached to harmonization process. harmo_summary(harmo_report) rm(harmo_report)  # After correction, re-run the process of harmonization with the corrected data  # processing elements. harmo_process(   dataschema = DEMO_dataschema,   data_proc_elem = `DEMO_data_processing_elements - final`,   name_report = "final_report",   output_harmo_folder = "DEMO/harmonized_datasets")  # re-index your files to include new files created index_DEMO <- file_index_create(folder = "DEMO")

what: Generate visual report of the harmonized variables
title: Main usage of harmonizR
text: Generate QA reports harmonized dataset(s) facilitate assessment harmonized dataset. html bookdown report generated showing summary statistics harmonized variable. statistics generated variable determined variable format, one three types: numerical, text, categorical. Statistics shown pooled harmonized dataset well study. DataSchema must specified. can specify output folder (specified, working directory default).
code: # pool your data in one tibble harmonized_study_DEMO_table_DEMO <-   harmonized_study_MELBOURNE_table_MELBOURNE %>%   bind_rows(harmonized_study_PARIS_table_PARIS) %>%   bind_rows(harmonized_study_TOKYO_table_TOKYO)  # use case 1: report of harmonized_study_DEMO_table_DEMO. harmo_visual_report(   harmonized_dataset = harmonized_study_DEMO_table_DEMO,   dataschema = DEMO_dataschema,   data_proc_elem = `DEMO_data_processing_elements - work in progress`,   to = "DEMO/reports/harmonized_DEMO"   # group_by = "adm_study" )  # re-index your files to include new files created index_DEMO <- file_index_create(folder = "DEMO")  # read the bookdown (or open the file named 'index.html' in your browser) file_index_read(index_DEMO,file_path = "DEMO/reports/harmonized_DEMO/docs/index.html")

what: Index the files in your harmonization R environment
title: Main usage of harmonizR V3
text: Create tibble listing files folder (recursively) useful metadata. can add filter query exclude folders indexing. tibble can also used quickly search location file. Finally, can read indexed files generate objects R environment. can access files list use function attach access (mandatory)
code: # create index of files that are in a  folder index_DEMO <- file_index_create(folder = "DEMO")  # search index for files matching a specific file path query file_index_search(index = index_DEMO, file_path = "study_specific_datasets")  # read the files and assign them into a list study_specific_datasets_list <- file_index_read(index = index_DEMO, file_path = "study_specific_datasets") dataschema <- file_index_read(index_DEMO, file_path = "dataschema") data_processing_elements <- file_index_read(index_DEMO, file_path = "data_processing_elements")  # attach the objects (not mandatory) attach(study_specific_datasets_list) # detach(study_specific_datasets_list) attach(dataschema)                   # detach(dataschema) attach(data_processing_elements)     # detach(data_processing_elements)

title: Main usage of harmonizR V3
text: can create study object tidy datasets data dictionaries make sure process ‘understands’ dataset(s) () attached data dictionary(ies)
code: # create study object MELBOURNE <- study_create(   dataset_list = list(dataset_MELBOURNE_1, dataset_MELBOURNE_2),    data_dict_list = dd_MELBOURNE_format_maelstrom) PARIS <- study_create(dataset_list = dataset_PARIS, data_dict_list = dd_PARIS_format_maelstrom) TOKYO <- study_create(dataset_list = dataset_TOKYO, data_dict_list = dd_TOKYO_format_opal_tagged)  participating_studies <- list(MELBOURNE = MELBOURNE,PARIS = PARIS, TOKYO = TOKYO)  View(participating_studies)  # this example is made for QA function, see below PARIS_for_QA <-    study_create(dataset_list = dataset_PARIS_for_QA, data_dict_list = dd_PARIS_for_QA)

what: Generate excel report(s) of the study-specific variables
title: Main usage of harmonizR V3
text: can generate quality assessment (QA) reports study datasets. facilitate assessment study-specific datasets, can generate excel-like report showing summary statistics study-specific variable. summary statistics generated according valueTypes. can specify data dictionary. can perform assessment one dataset specifically participating studies
code: # use case 1: report of a dataset and associated data dictionary assessment_PARIS_for_QA <-    study_assessement_report(     dataset = dataset_PARIS_for_QA,     data_dict = dd_PARIS_for_QA)  View(assessment_PARIS_for_QA) write_excel_allsheets("DEMO/reports/assessment_PARIS_for_QA.xlsx", assessment_PARIS_for_QA)  # use case 1: report of studies all at once. assessment_studies <- study_assessement_report(study_list = participating_studies) View(assessment_studies)

what: Read and run the data processing rules and generate the harmonized dataset
title: Main usage of harmonizR V3
text: Read run data processing elements file line line whole harmonize study-specific dataset. Error messages generated automatically help identify sources errors data processing elements. Separate scripts pre-processing datasets (harmonization) post-processing (harmonization) can integrated process.
code: # Example 1: run the process of harmonization with data processing elements containing errors harmonized_study_DEMO <- harmo_process(   study_list = participating_studies,    dataschema = DEMO_dataschema,   data_proc_elem = `DEMO_data_processing_elements - with error`)  # Example 2: use the function harmo_summary() to access the errors.  # In your environment, you will find a report attached to harmonization process. harmo_summary(harmonized_study_DEMO)  # After correction, re-run the process of harmonization with the corrected data  # processing elements. harmonized_study_DEMO <- harmo_process(   study_list = participating_studies,    dataschema = DEMO_dataschema,   data_proc_elem = `DEMO_data_processing_elements - final`)  View(harmonized_study_DEMO)
